definition: The Forest and Landscape Restoration Opportunities dataset is a global dataset that shows where degraded forest lands have the potential to be restored. The dataset was created in 2011 based on current and historic forest extent data at a spatial resolution of 1 kilometer (km). It presents the results as three different forms of forest restoration: wide-scale, mosaic, and remote. Wide-scale restoration aims to restore closed forests (canopy density greater than 45%) in areas where they previously dominated the landscape.
title: Forest Restoration Opportunity
citation: Potapov, Peter, Lars Laestadius, and Susan Minnemeyer. 2011. "Global map of forest landscape restoration opportunities." World Resources Institute: Washington, DC. Online at www.wri.org/forest-restoration-atlas.
